snippet: Poland says it is open to foreign direct investment from any source but might balk at the acqusition of domestic banks by a Russian lender.
abstract: Polish authorities announce that they are open to an inflow of Russian capital, even as they pursue a strategy of bolstering Polish banks against Russian takeovers; some Poles, harboring Soviet-era resentment, oppose the idea of Russian takeovers, and are pushing for regulations to prevent them.
lead_paragraph: Poland says it is open to foreign direct investment from any source but might balk at the acqusition of domestic banks by a Russian lender.

headline.main: Poland Trying to Build Banks' Defenses
headline.print_headline: Poland, Cautiously, Says It Would Welcome Russian Cash
